{{cpp/chrono/duration/title|count}}
{{cpp/chrono/duration/navbar}}
{{ddcl|since=c++11|
constexpr rep count() const;
}}

Returns the number of ticks for this duration.

===Parameters===
(none)

===Return value===
The number of ticks for this duration.

===Example===
{{example 
|code=
#include &lt;chrono&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;

int main()
{
    std::chrono::milliseconds ms{3}; // 3 milliseconds
    // 6000 microseconds constructed from 3 milliseconds
    std::chrono::microseconds us = 2 * ms;
    // 30Hz clock using fractional ticks
    std::chrono::duration&lt;double, std::ratio&lt;1, 30&gt;&gt; hz30(3.5);

    std::cout &lt;&lt; "3 ms duration has " &lt;&lt; ms.count() &lt;&lt; " ticks\n"
              &lt;&lt; "6000 us duration has " &lt;&lt; us.count() &lt;&lt; " ticks\n"
              &lt;&lt; "3.5 30Hz duration has " &lt;&lt; hz30.count() &lt;&lt; " ticks\n";       
}
|output=
3 ms duration has 3 ticks
6000 us duration has 6000 ticks
3.5 30Hz duration has 3.5 ticks
}}
